intro: Dichaelia, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Africa, with some extending into parts of Asia and the Middle East. The plants are characterized by their showy, often colorful flowers and milky sap, which can be toxic. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, with opposite leaves and woody stems. Dichaelia species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions.
